content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofEngland/The-Great-Fire-of-London/
ENDCONTEXT
The Great Fire of London in 1666 began in a large blacksmith shop on Bread Street. The fire ravaged the entire city, sparing only a few structures, including 87 churches and over 13,000 homes. It's estimated that thousands perished in the disaster.

ENDINPUT
